critique: This document pertains to the withdrawal of public lands in Arkansas from settlement, location, sale, entry, and all forms of appropriation pending a resurvey. It cites specific acts of Congress as its authority. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, or emphasis on national security vs. civil liberties. The action seems neutral regarding economic regulation and social inclusion. The federalism aspect is slightly tilted towards federal control as it involves federal land management.
